website_summaries.verdict: High efficiency brushless motor can handle all your tough trim jobs.
pros: Two trim lines and ergonomic design can help you tackle difficult trim projects
Cordless trimmer cuts are just as powerful as any gas model
Two power settings can tackle any weed issues you may have
3 amp hour battery and charger included
cons: Small safety guard may be a concern

website_summaries.verdict: This durable electric cordless trimmer is a beast, capable of powering through thick blackberry vines. Lighter and easier to use than gas models.
pros: Comes with a very powerful Lithium-ion battery
Operates at different speeds and power and features a superior dual cutting line
Great choice for those wishing to end the hassle and noise of gas models
cons: Some owners have noted that the guard is narrow, making eye protection a must

customer_reviews.title: Changed the head and much happier. Original head is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Original head is a piece of junk. Same with the 20V model. Switched it out with a Husqvarna 537388101 Universal T35 which works much nicer. Works like a gas model. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo guy

customer_reviews.title: HOLY SMOKES!! It just got REAL!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I mow/weed-eat 6 acres, and I've lost count of how many different gas powered string trimmers we've gone through. After trying the WORX GT, (and returning it the next day) I decided battery powered was not the route to go. It was years before I would try another battery powered trimmer.... However, owning a HUGE arsenal of Dewalt 20v Max tools, I thought I'd see if they had any lawn tools available. 60v that also works with my 20v tools! REALLY? This thing is the REAL DEAL! ●TONS of power! ● Looong battery life! ●Great auto-feed! ●Well balanced! ●Fast charging! I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Save your money! Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box from Amazon...the battery was stolen...shipped it back ...received full refund! Bought the same model at Homedepot...$15.00 cheaper plus 10% off for military discount! Charged the battery per instructions...worked better...more power than my 4 cycle plan weedeater! I used ip the full supplied head fill of string. Reloaded the head...pit in a freshly charged battery...went 10 more feet cutting and the motor caught fire...smoked and will never run again. This is junk! Took it back..got full refund. Dewalt knows the motor is junk....no warranty on the motor...save your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: hvywpns

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: been waiting forever for dewalt to send me a new 60v battery after the first quit on me after 2 uses but yet you can still buy a 60v battery on the websites and in stores but dewalt cant take care of their customers I finally ended up picking up a worx 2x20v trimmer sucks I had to buy 2 trimmers in 1 year due to dewalt not caring about their customers the worx is working great but the dewalt is collecting dust because dewalt doesnt want to honor warranty. the work truck I work on will be phasing out the dewalt drills as they get worn out with other brands since my experience with the 60v was crap
customer_reviews.author: paul wall

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, the only downfall is the guard on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer, the only downfall is the guard on this trimmer is non-existent. I used this for the first time the other day and everything else is great except for the guard issue. You will seriously have grass, dirt, and rock fly up on your legs and onto your face so be sure to wear eye protectors. I'm surprised DeWalt hasn't done something about this as everyone on here seems to have the same issue. I'll change my review if they replace the guard but I would hold off on purchasing this until a newer unit is out with an updated (bigger) guard.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D.

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy about this purchase at all
customer_reviews.text: I have dozens of Dewalt tools and batteries. After only a few days of use, the new battery on this weedwacker has failed. I've tried it in several chargers and it won't take a charge from any of them. As a big expense on the weedwacker is obviously this new 9amp battery, I am not happy about this purchase at all!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: the 60v max has been a great system for me
customer_reviews.text: the 60v max has been a great system for me, started out with the grinder for work and fabrication (albeit, a 2ah battery is limited, great for short jobs!) so when I saw the dewalt weed wacker and chainsaw, i originally bought the chainsaw- but they weren't going to be shipping for awhile so i changed my order to weedwacker, great choice... this thing trims the entire property, havent had to refill the spool but even if it does go through alot, thats a better deal than oil/gas and constant maintenance cleaning air filters. weed wacked right after a light rain, still worked well
customer_reviews.author: JCrain

customer_reviews.title: The Husqvarna T35 universal head fits, do it!
customer_reviews.text: The Husqvarna T35 universal head fits, you have to unscrew (reverse threads) the crazy dewalt piece then it fits right on, see my pic. The flathead screwdriver holds the unit in place, turn clockwise to loosen (reverse threads). Easy breezy. Solved this thanks to YouTube, search "Convert A Dewalt Brushless Max String Trimmer For A Universal Head" Great trimmer overall. Battery doesn't last forever, but two 60V batteries was equivalent to a full tank of gas in my Stihl, so no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 0 aph the power was great and the small line worked just fine the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: This weed wacker is a pleasure to use it's lite weight I bought the 60volt 9.0 aph the power was great and the small line worked just fine the battery lasted 20 min exact on my yard but the grass was damp and tall it made it farther than I thought very happy with this buy no more fixing my gasser every spring here are a before and after
customer_reviews.author: wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Same great battery/motor as on many other De Walt tools
customer_reviews.text: Same great battery/motor as on many other De Walt tools, this time on a surprisingly poorly designed string trimmer. The shaft is too long, the guard is way too small, half of what it cuts will reach your eyes and your body. In one minute of work you're dirty all over. The string cassette is cheaply constructed, flimsy and probably will break soon. All that for a tool that is not cheap at all! Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 trimmers all with dead batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Just like Mark D's review. The batteries are dying and DeWalt does not have any replacements available. Last time I called they had no ETA on when they would be receiving more. A $240 paperweight. The manufacturer cannot fulfill its own warranty and are making the customer deal with it at their own expense of time, money, and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Near-perfect beast!
customer_reviews.text: I got this after my 10-year old gas trimmer finally quit. NO MORE mixing gas/oil, NO MORE first-start-of-the-season workout. I was torn between this one and the 20V trimmer, I'm sure the 20V would have met my expectations, but this bad boy waaaay exceeded them. As per other reviewers, I got the wider guard and Husqvarna replacement spool, both 100% necessary... without these upgrades, I'd have rated it 3 or 4 stars max.
customer_reviews.author: Not Born Yesterday

customer_reviews.title: Defective design of the string head, avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: Although the power of this trimmer is great, and the batteries last a long time, the head that holds the string is a glaringly defective design. After using the unit for a couple of minutes, the string inevitably breaks, half of the time, instead of tapping the head to release more, the string just retracts back into the head unit, which must then be taken apart and string pulled back through, only to have to repeat the process every 5 minutes. I am still using the factory installed string and head. I wish I could return this thing as it is nothing but aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Noe

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a newer model
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer worked well for the first 4 times I used it. It no longer works. The motor just quit working. It hasn't been used in damp conditions nor on anything larger than the common weed/grass found around a well maintained yard. I don't recommend it unless they figure out the issues. When it did work, I liked it which is why I gave it 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: I watched a few youtube vids before buying so I knew what I was getting. The weed eater really works well but the small guard dos nothing! I tried it to see how bad it was and was pelted with every piece of grass and dirt that the string hit, it was horrible. I had to order the Dewalt N512929 Replacement Guard, 15in. It's a must if you want the perfect setup. I've only ever needed the low setting and the batter last long enough for me to do my whole yard easily. It's not a light as I was expecting but it's balanced so well that I hardly notice while using.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L

customer_reviews.title: BUMPER HEAD COMES OFF WAY WAY TOO EASILY
customer_reviews.text: I was trimming tall grass, nothing crazy, the second time I ever used the trimmer. And all of a sudden the trimmer was the mess you see it was in the picture because the bumper head had fallen off. I didn’t even realize the head had come off because I didn’t hit anything hard, like I said, I was trimming tall grass. So now Dewalt wants me to buy a whole new trimmer head assembly. No instructions to rewind the head I’ve got. It’s a nice trimmer but I don’t want to have to put up with a bumper head that falls off, in my opinion, way way too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Product lasted less than one season under light use
customer_reviews.text: Defective tool. Used it just enough to change the string for the first time and it wont start. have bought thousands of dollars worth of the 60v DeWalt tools. This one was defective.I'm assuming I have no recourse since it's been 9 months since I purchased it. Was a great tool for the 3 or 4 hours of use it got.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Need to upgrade the GUARD DeWalt.  Come on !  Get it in gear!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just like the flexvolt chainsaw I got a year ago...this tool is a gem. I was ready to quit before the battery was. I like that it is the same charger and battery as the chainsaw, but now I doubt I'll ever last long enough to need two batteries. One critical comment, as others have said, the rock guard is worthless. It realy could use a "REAL" guard instead of this baby toy. SHAME on you DeWalt. How could you let such inadequacy get past the testing stage??? Knock down one star for shear stupidity.
customer_reviews.author: AM/FM

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Used twice now will not work ahhhhhh How disappointing I own approx 40 dewalt tools and batteries this is by far not what I expected from dewalt
customer_reviews.author: daniel nelson

customer_reviews.title: Throw that gas trimmer away!
customer_reviews.text: This is it folks. This is the one. A trimmer that has no cord, is even more powerful than a typical gas trimmer, doesn't require hearing protection, and refueling doesn't stink or require any fancy mix gas. Click out done battery, click in fresh one. Don't get the wimpy 20v one. The 40v one is just like this, except you can't share the batteries with your drills and saws and air compressor. If you are a landscaper, then the 40v more runtime might be worth the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: TheMogget

customer_reviews.title: Caution: needs new version expensive batteries & head jams often
customer_reviews.text: They do not tell you that you need to upgrade to Dewalts new super expensive batteries. This is my third Dewalt weed eater and it is actually great other than having had to spend $250 for new batteries when my old ones were perfectly fine. They need to disclose this in the description and up top so people know. The head clogs about every 5 minutes so you need to take it apart and often the head is really tough to remove. It's a real pain when you want to be working. The positives - the power is great and this model is a bit lighter than the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Occy Joe

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April and replaced it in August, 1st time was fine, second the battery did not last so i had to start then charge then start again, 3rd the same. 4th time the head started smoking and it stopped working altogether. I love the idea but not the final product, I own several of their other tools so this one is not a true example of their product lines.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth the money. i own many Dewalt batteries so i bought the tool only. It does not lack power whatsoever and is not heavy at all. when reading reviews I read numerous people complaining about the guard being too small and being hit with grass when using and i disagree. When weed eating regardless of how big the guard is you will get some sort of grass on you. I didnt think i got hit anymore then any other weed eater. You cant beat the convenience of putting a battery in and going. no oil, no gas, no choke. highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: trash
customer_reviews.text: i am on my second one (thanks to DeWalt replacing the one that died for no reason) and they have redesigned the end to make it even worse. you practically have to disassemble the unit to make the string longer and the string breaks on grass right away. good luck trying to get anything done with this. DeWalt really fell off...i have so many barely used broken DeWalt products...they are still clean and new looking...they just don't work
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: This unit has Issues...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bare tool because I already had batteries. The first time I used it (within 5 minutes) the string broke off on one side requiring me to take the head off to get more string out...not good. I’ve not used it again since repairing string. So I may write another review after more use BUT I can already tell the string head is chine junk and the Gard is inadequate for protection... Dewalt needs to step up and fix these issues !
customer_reviews.author: Farmer boy

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power and longevity only problem is string feed ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power and longevity only problem is string feed it tends to shear and back up into the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bonfiglio

customer_reviews.title: ... this new trimmer in early June and am extremely pleased. The 9 amp-hr 60/20 volt battery pack came ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new trimmer in early June and am extremely pleased. The 9 amp-hr 60/20 volt battery pack came with the trimmer, and I'm typically able to trim my entire 1/2 acre lot perimeter, house, under shrubs and hedges and garage with power left over... it helped when I figured out that it is variable speed over Hi and Low range, and 80% of my trimming can be Low range, using high range only for brambles and vines. I recommend this trimmer, but, important to know, like most high end trimmers, feeding new trimmer wire is wound on the spindle manually, and requires some dexterity. Even so, it's impresively powerful and tremendously quiet compared to a gas trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is 20-25 minutes after one year
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer! It’s light. It cuts everything I need it to. It’s great. Only one problem... the battery dies after 20 minutes. I’ve had it a year now. I think that in the first few months I used it last year the battery lasted a bit longer - maybe 30 minutes. But now it’s a typical 20 minutes and it dies. If I had 2 more fully charged batteries in a backpack that I could switch out, I’d be happy. I have always drained and recharged the battery fully. I’ve never used it half way... But the batteries themselves are very expensive so... I guess next time I’ll go with a gas powered version.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth c berg

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the process of trying to thin the heard of my gas powered machines and replace them with battery operated equivalents. Trying to simplify... no more gas treatments, difficult starts, oil changes, fumes, noise, vibrations. I can say without hesitation that this Dewalt 60V line trimmer has as much or more power than my 29cc gas trimmer. I live on a wooded, 2-acre property and really demand a lot of performance and durability out of the tools and machines I use. So far, this trimmer has been up to the task and the battery life has been impressive. I have high expectations when it comes to Dewalt, and they always seem to deliver.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Needs a larger guard
customer_reviews.text: Just got and used the Dewalt weedeater for the first time. Right away I noticed how powerful it was. Impressive especially for a battery operated one. It cuts great and for me, still had 2 bars left on the battery when I was finished. The one thing I really don't like is how it throws all of the debris right at you. I mean everything but the kitchen sink. Others have mentioned this and suggested larger guards. Im looking for one now. If not for that one negative {which may be resloved} Dewalt has made another great tool to add to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Ed In Concord

customer_reviews.title: Weeds will run when they see this coming!
customer_reviews.text: A true beast of lawn trimmers. Never have I wired eye protection before with other trimners but need to now which tells me 2 things.... 1. It is incredibly powerful and cuts through quarter inch thick stocks.... 2. Also tells me that it guards are poorly designed. To conserve battery life use at half throttle full when needed only. I found out that at full speed I was able to get 35 minutes of life. It does have some weight to it, battery is big and heavy. It's a trade off the power it gives you. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Only runs for 5 minutes then quits.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it last august and have only used it about 5 hours. Only runs for 5 minutes then quits. Battery is charged. This is an expensive dog and i have to drive 45 miles to service center. Very disappointed with this DeWalt. Turns out the service center they told me to drive to has not been a DeWalt repair center for over two years. What a joke. Called DeWalt and they say they are sending me another battery...I wish I had recorded the conversation...because now I not sure I believe them. If it does not show up in 10 days I will notify the Better Business Bureau.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, light weight, goes through line fast, and tears through batteries faster
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer but the speed with which it goes through line and batteries is pretty crazy. I like how the loading system is design but am concerned it will wear out because it is all plastic. I have 3 6 Amp 60V batteries and I used all three in one day to get around the house. Seems a touch excessive for what I was doing in regards to power usage. I was able to cut through 60 branches with my power saw on a single charge. I do like the electric option as I don't have to deal with 2 cycle gas anymore.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spliedt

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt has never let me down until now
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt has never let me down until now. I was on the fence about it I had read mixed positive and negative reviews but dewalt had never failed me to date so I gave the 60 Volt model trimmer a chance. The motore completely fryes on me just days after my return option is up I was not ruff on it at all used it maybe twice a month for 3 months on a relatively small areas then the motor smokes on me and refuses to run there appears to be no visible phisacle damage that I can detect. Nothing iv purchased from dewalt has ever faulterd on me to date so this is disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Unit works great. Charge that's included doesmt work with included batter
customer_reviews.text: The weedeater works great and I can do all of my weed eating edging with only 1 bar of battery. BUT the charger they send with the unit isnt compatible with the battery. When I called Dewalt they sent out a new battery that works with the charger but it's a smaller battery than came with the unit. I called them back and they were supposed to send me email with how to return battery and they never sent email. So I ended up having to order a different charger online that they actually show and sell with the battery that comes with this unit
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Harris

customer_reviews.title: insanity in a string trimmer - unstoppable
customer_reviews.text: this thing is insanely powerful. takes down any vegetation you can think of. battery lasts forever and it is lightweight and quiet. great that I don't have to worry about cords or pre-mix gas. just grab and go. highly recommend for anyone who has dewalt power tools since the batteries are all compatible (20V). 10/10 highly recommend for anyone other than professional landscaper who has tons of 2 stroke gas equipment. i went 4 stroke on the leaf blower so having a battery cordless string trimmer made sense. friends are amazed at the power it has, and doesn't piss off the whole neighborhood either.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful! Sucks up Battery Power on High.
customer_reviews.text: This things is as powerful as a gas trimmer. There is two settings. Low and High. Most jobs will take the low setting so only us High if you really need it. It is very powerful. I was actually surprised. It comes with the new FlexVolt 9HA battery. Just as a precaution. Drain the battery before charging for the first time. I had problems with the battery not charging even though it only had 1 bar. Once I drained the 1 bar (which took less than 5 minutes on high) I was able to fully charge it. This thing is evil powerful on high. Wear Pants and safety glasses!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Brush guard is way too small
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little beast. Love the battery life and the quality of the trimmer. That being said, the brush guard is tiny. When you trim weeds, it throws all the debris back at your legs. When wearing shorts, your legs end up all bloody from the little knicks and scrapes as it throws cut debris at the operator. Horrible design. I duct taped a large piece of cardboard to the unit to prevent this issue but come on Dewalt...Did anyone at your company ever test it??? Clearly not....
customer_reviews.author: McChesney

customer_reviews.title: Issues after using it second time. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: It would of been great - worked great first use. Cut grass for 30 mins. Second time - full charged - start and then stop 30-40 second intervals. Would not stay on. Even put it back on the charger and still did it after another try day later. Returned. Called dewalt and they said they send me a refurbished one. Nope I paid for brand new I don’t want a refurbished. Still haven’t gotten my money back from amazon. Return was approved. Don’t want another!
customer_reviews.author: Solo-life

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ( and I hate weed eating)
customer_reviews.text: I hate to weed eat, so I got this in hope that I'd do it more often. I like it alot. Way more convenient then keeping up with gas and oil, or fighting to get a gas one started. This weed eater is easy to wind, the shield is small but doesn't really bother me. And if you already have 60v tools, then it's a no brainer if you hate weed eating like I do.
customer_reviews.author: dane

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work for more than a few seconds at ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work for more than a few seconds at a time so I am returning it. The battery indicates that it is charged but the device won't work despite trouble shooting and multiple attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Deb

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. If you take care of it. It will take care of you.
customer_reviews.text: A little on the pricey side. But works great in all heights of grass. It's weird not working on it though. All you do is plug and go. Which is very nice. I have only ran the battery dead once. That was from cutting 2'-3' grass for over 45 minutes. You have to remember it is a battery and your not going to get as much out of it as you would a gas trimmer. But for being a battery it is very surprisingly powerful and do pretty much what you need it to do, to an extent. Home owner use it is perfect. I trim for over an hour with it with each use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Harbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Just like gas. This baby has no problem hogin' through heavy weeds. The 3ah battery has more then enough juice to do my 1/2 acer at least twice and I have a lot of high grass along the perimeter. There is just one thing that is disappointing about this wacker. Its the shroud. It offers little to no protection against debris. I get at least 3 times as dirty with this one as I do with my Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: C,J Hayenga

customer_reviews.title: Works good but not trouble free.
customer_reviews.text: It’s working pretty good so far. The trimmer line likes to pull back into the head when the line gets too short (does it with either the 0.80 or 0.95 line) this requires me to open up the head (happens so much, I’ve become an expert at it). The battery hangs up in the unit so that removing it requires me to tap on the bottom of the battery when it is upside down, while pressing the latch. This is something that I don’t have a problem with on Dewalt’s chain saw using the same battery type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery is junk and expensive
customer_reviews.text: I love the weed trimmer, however the battery is trash. I used it maybe 4-5 times and the battery shorted out. Since it was after the 90 day battery warranty I had to buy a new one which I found online for $130. After using that battery last summer and storing the battery inside my home over winter, it’s now shorted as well. I’ve talked to a few friends that use other DEWALT equipment with the same battery, they too have had issues with the exact battery. The trimmer works great but not sure its worth it, having to buy a new battery every summer. Perhaps it’s just bad luck but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love.
customer_reviews.text: Small gas engines are so finicky, this thing is an excellent replacement and i will never go back. The battery life is long enough to do around the whole farm and its light weight enough for the wife, best part is you dont have to listen to a motor next to your head the whole time. I did replace the head with a grass gator, I didnt try the stock head but after reading a lot of reviews I decided to do it right away. Auto feed string has always caused issues for us.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomeds

customer_reviews.title: Looove it!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a weed eater before. We needed a new one as our old gas one was spitting gas everywhere and overall failing. We have several DeWalt battery tools and I wanted a lightweight weed eater that I could use since my husband works alot. Got it today and put it right to use! Perfect! Battery lasted my entire yard. Super easy to use. After I discovered the easy way to get more string it was even easier than what I was doing. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Karrien

customer_reviews.title: trim line gets stuck below the head cord doesnt stay in teh trimmer dispensor
customer_reviews.text: so now I spend 1/2hour getting cord out and it does it again , so i give up try to check warranty and parts list and they dont recognize the trimmer on part list under manuals and call ed them and they put you on hold at dewalt are all Chinese company and tools this hard to get info on . what a crap company with cheap line trimmer good luck . only had of 2 years use once every 2 weeks head dispenser wore out and design sucks trim gets stuck under the aluminum flange under dispenser and impossible to get it out .
customer_reviews.author: a96xz003

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but keep your mouth shut.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 acre yard which requires a great deal of trimming. The DeWalt 60V provides just enough battery power to complete the task without a battery recharge. Ample power to knock down the taller grass/weeds and good balance to avoid feeling like you are doing reps in the weight room. The rub: As mentioned in previous reviews, the shield is minimal "at best". You are covered in grass shortly after you engage in your weed eating routine. Of course DeWalt offers an "optional" larger shield that you can purchase separately. Otherwise, safety glasses or a face shield is highly recommended. If you don't have a face shield, be sure to keep your mouth shut.
customer_reviews.author: Cary A. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: As good as my gas trimmer.  Powerful, light, and battery lasts long enough
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of my gas Husqvarna trimmer bogging down and failing to start. I decided to replace it with a battery trimmer and I'm glad I did. This trimmer is plenty powerful for my normal home owner lawn/garden use. I trim and edge a 2k square foot lawn and This trimmer handles the chore with ease. I can usually get 2 full uses on a single battery charge. I have a 2nd battery just in case I forgot to recharge the first one. Pros: Light As powerful as my gas trimmer MUCH quieter than my gas Cons: Need a 2nd battery for sure (just in case you forget to charge)
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Raynor II

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, best for larger areas
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent product probably better suited for larger areas. I got this because i needed a trimmer with enough power to cut some brush and still be able to trim my lawn. The lawn grass is very soft so it takes a-lot to trim with a trimmer and I didn't want to get a mower. One of the most important thing I should have known about this trimmer is that it is not attachment capable, so do your research.
customer_reviews.author: Reid S

customer_reviews.title: gets through tough stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine holds up amazing! I am impressed. I switched it out for my gasoline machine because I didnt like the fumes. And this batterie powered one is lighter and works just as good!!! I am not joking. I used it all spring and summer no problems.I got the 60V batteries though! Only downside is the string replacement. It has got to be improved!! And the protection shield on the bottom is missing so you are covered in weeds by the end of the work. . .
customer_reviews.author: marleen brauns

customer_reviews.title: A powerful weedeater
customer_reviews.text: Great weedeater cuts through everything plenty of power. I use the dewalt 60v flex 9.0amh battery and none stop on high lasts about half hour, but you cut through a lot in that half hour. The string it comes with dosnt last very long, but if use .095 works great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars is for the seller not the for the product. (Trimmer is garbage! don't buy! )
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with the product. Carry only Dewalt tools. On this one clutch stopped working after 30 min. Luckily shipping back for the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Altman

customer_reviews.title: WORKHORSE
customer_reviews.text: This is equal to a Still FS85. Powerful enough for commercial and farm. Get some .095 Shakespeare PRO TORQUE High Performance twist line. Also get a carry strap 'cause this is as HEAVY as any 4stroke TROYBUILT. Fun to run. Extra batteries cost as much as another weed-eater so might as well buy another weed-eater than a single battery. If buying another battery, watch out to match your Ah to expected performance. Generally, cheap batteries equal less Ah. There are aftermarket batteries out there.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Loss faith in dewalt
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a turd burger. Made me lose faith in dewalt. No string at the head within a few seconds of use. Have to restring over and over. Worse trimmer ever. I have used it twice. On my third use I am 10 days past prime return period. Called dewalt since they have a one year warranty and they are closed on a Saturday and no mention of their hours. Just refers you to their worthless website. Wish I had not bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Nice trimmer but buy additional string head
customer_reviews.text: So much easier And less time consuming than my gas trimmer. Only drawback is the double stringer head: can become tedious trying to replace the string. Recommend buying a backup stringer head just in case you run out of string in the middle of a job, then restringing becomes too me consuming.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but bent after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer bent after first few uses. I really like this trimmer. It has great power and good battery life. However after a few uses the lower portion of the pole bent to a curved shape. After calling Dewalt they said I could mail it to the nearest service center 350 miles away. It is summer and I still need to trim weekly. I feel the least they could do is send out a new replacement, assuming they fixed the strength of the lower pole. I am now trying to contact them again for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It worked GREAT for one 15 minute session
customer_reviews.text: It worked GREAT for one 15 minute session, then did not ever work again. Even with help from more experienced people than I. It needs repair, and I need help finding out who does this
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power for an electric
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power for an electric. MORE power than a plug-in electric, actually. It's about as powerful as the smaller gas weed whackers, and SOOO MUCH EASIER to get started in the spring after resting all winter. No gas to mix, no plugs or air filter to change. No emptying the gas tank before putting it away into winter storage. I RECOMMEND STRONGLY to take a small hand broom or semi stiff brush to clean off the electric motor venthilation holes after you use it. The batteries seem to give you almost an hour of straight through weed whacking time and I recommend using 0.095in line, it can handle it and it lasts SOOO much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Nils Mork

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive, but the auto-feed head needs work
customer_reviews.text: I've had this trimmer for only two days, and I love it! Plenty of power, good balance, easy to use. I bought the "tool only" and I am running it with DCB609 batteries. I used it for over 30 minutes and still had 2/3 of the battery left (according to the battery monitor). I only gave it 4 stars because the auto-feed head is inconsistent. To be fair, I have had trouble with auto-feed or "bump-feed" heads on Echo and Stilh as well. I replaced the DeWalt head with an Echo 21560056 (manual quick-load) that I had for another trimmer, running .105 line. The trimmer just eats grass and weeds, even at low power. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Change the head
customer_reviews.text: With this Husq. head I give it a 4, (But the shield is not strong on the Dewalt). I simply unscrewed the head and screwed on this replacement as suggested by another buyer. Husqvarna 537388101 Universal T35 Tap Advance Straight Shaft String Trimmer Head Prewound With .095-Inch Line I don't know if the regular Husqvarna replacement would have had the same screw threads as the universal. I thought I would have needed an adapter. I didn't.. The powerfully strong .095 line chipped away at my shield, or was it little stones? I am looking for a shield replacement. Carbon fiber shield anyone? This Husq.head is much, "MUCH" easier to open up and change, or adjust, the cutting string.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT DCST970X1 FLEXVOLT 60V MAX=costly piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: After barely over a year of gentle use, the head stopped spinning (and only makes jerking motion when you turn the trimmer on) - the condition that is very eloquently described in numerous reviews. Today's DEWALT is not DEWALT of yore. Stay away from this poorly manufactured piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a short period of time
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Get a fast charger and 12 AH battery or 2, to go with it. As of yesterday, this review now reads - It worked great. Then the motor or something went bad. Now when you pull the trigger it will barely turn. over 3 hours round trip to a Dewalt service center - X2 if We want it repaired Do not buy this without the extended warranty
customer_reviews.author: J. Savoie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Very powerful on high. 40 min runtime on battery
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. The person that posted that it is heavy really needs to goto the gym. Lol. This is light. Also, it is very powerful. Low power is similar to a cheap gas weadeater. High power is similar to a Stihl weadeater. Very powerful. It cuts thick grass and weeds with ease without bogging down. The battery life leaves a lot to be desired. 40 min is all you get out of a fully charged 9amp battery that comes with it. It doesn't go longer by running it on low, just not as powerful. All and all, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has bought several Dewalt products lately and been impressed. Funny thing I am actually the one who uses it!!! It is quiet, light, and easy to use. We live on a cattle ranch and have a variety of pesky weeds. This thing cuts through even the nastiest of weeds on the high setting and easily cute grass and littler weeds on the lower setting. Battery life is amazing, have never had to stop a project to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: ranchy momma

customer_reviews.title: Best DeWalt tool I've got so far!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy! I wanted a trimmer but didn't want to deal with the hassle of a gas trimmer and the aggravation of it not starting after winter. So when DeWalt came out with this I got it. The price was a bit high, but after using it i was well assured that my money was well spent! I'm able to do my yard and my neighbors yard on a single charge. It's even able to cut down the thick grass in my grandfather's ditch. The battery even works with my other DeWalt tools as well which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: John Kibby

customer_reviews.title: powerful, high quality battery tool
customer_reviews.text: extremely happy with my new wacker. i did not get the string i ordered at the same time but i was itching to play my toy....it so happens that it came loaded! i got to try it out immediately and i was extremely happy and surprised how powerful it was even with low mode. low mode is more power than i will ever need, i am beyond happy..not to mention i ordered wednesday night and found it friday afternoon on my door step. that was also awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Recomend
customer_reviews.text: Very good trimmer, I was uncertain about a battery powered one but the quality of my other Dewalt tools got me to take a chance on this. Cuts through anything I need it to. The cutting head seems fine to me, other reviews said it needed swapped, only 2 uses so far. 6 ah batteries I was using last about 30-45 minutes of cutting. I also think the shield is just fine, legs get covered in grass but I expect that doing yard work. It's nice not to mix gas and have the vibration in my arms.
customer_reviews.author: Pauly Chronopolis

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer as soon as you buy the accessory cover from Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone said before me, the trimmer is a beast! BUT, the string guard that comes with it is a joke and you will get covered from head to toe with what ever you are trimming. Dewalt does offer a larger cover (refer to you manual for the part number) and it is a game changer. With the new larger cover this tool is a dream to use. It sucks that Dewalt does not ship this with the larger cover, and the last time i checked the only place to order it is from Dewalt. Honestly without the larger string guard I would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: Mikey B

customer_reviews.title: Wise purchase - Long life
customer_reviews.text: This was a wise decision. I had been using a 54V Echo unit for 2-3 years, and had battery problems so, in lieu of spending almost as much for a new battery - I grabbed this Dewalt deal. SO FAR, this was a very wise choice. Works great and battery lasts much longer than the Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Reese

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Dewalt built another great piece of equipment to help me work.
customer_reviews.text: Balanced, powerful and electrically efficient! Dewalt has made another great product! The line of flex volt tools is very impressive, I love the extra battery power the flex volt provides. 2 speeds makes this tool strong enough to cut big weeds and small saplings, dewalt trimmer line is a cut above e eything I have ever used. Thank you! A larger debris shield would be the only helpful suggestion for a change.
customer_reviews.author: Jimminnm

customer_reviews.title: MORE POWER THAN MY GAS TRIMMER...
customer_reviews.text: ... yet lighter. This is the civilized way to hack the weeds. This machine is so quiet. After 30 minutes with the gas trimmer my hands would always suffer from the vibration. That's not a problem with the Dewalt and I cover more territory quicker. It's actually hard to bog this beast down.
customer_reviews.author: Woody J.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I like the variable speed trigger, it has a different feel than a corded Weed whacker. It feels a little top-heavy with the battery being in the back , just takes a little getting used to. It’s hands-down better than any corded One. I have the larger capacity battery and it’s more than enough for my front and backyard
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Has the power
customer_reviews.text: Has the power. Low and high speed is nice touch. Battery life amounts to 1 tank of gas compared to my gas weed eater. If you have any amount of trimming to do, you will want another battery. I had 3 batteries and a fast charger I use with my chainsaw so no down time, other wise waiting for it to charge. I use .095 line , the .080 line it comes with is to wimpy. Never got a bad tool that dewalt makes
customer_reviews.author: Newell Adair

customer_reviews.title: There must be a better way to feed new string
customer_reviews.text: Feeding new string is very difficult. There are 2 small holes you need to feed the string through and it is very hard to do. There must be a better way to feed new string. I don't recommend it due to the difficulty feeding string.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Powerful weed eater
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more powerful than other trimmers. By the time the battery wears down, I am as well! (Good planning.) Two string system and power to really eat through weeds. I have a gas powered Stihl. This is powerful enough to do everything I need until I need to cut down stuff with the plastic blades.
customer_reviews.author: Douglass W. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good bye oil and gas, hello sparky.
customer_reviews.text: This weed eater it does what it supposed to do, I was able to weed eat all around my home to which is almost an acre. I was amazed of the power this brings as a battery power product by far this device has changed the way I look at gas. Very economical it will save you money on the long run. No more gas, oil, spark plug etc...Something to think about. Highly recommended you won’t regretted. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: knightcount69

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to 2-stroke lawn equipment!
customer_reviews.text: 2-stroke lawn equipment has been the bane of my existence. It's absolutely infuriating to get to what should be the end of my lawn maintenance, only to find I have to spend an hour or more working on a weed eater that doesn't want to run. I bought the Dewalt Flexvolt after much research and knowing I wanted to stay with the Dewalt family of products. I do not feel like I am missing anything when it comes to the power of this trimmer. And I can't put into words how awesome it is to simply put in a battery and pull the trigger. I am already looking into the other Flexvolt tools to add to my arsenal!
customer_reviews.author: Heath Davis

customer_reviews.title: LOOKOUT FOR THE SMOKE.. YOUR TRIMMER IS DEAD ONCE YOU SEE IT
customer_reviews.text: After t uses this trimmer smoked and went dead on me.. dewalt you need to do better than that.. the battery life is crapppp..
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: the best weed whacker I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best weed whacker I've ever owned. The battery lasts about 30 minutes doing pretty heavy yard work, and I'm not talking about just cutting grass. I have used this string trimmer to trim the bushes along my driveway. This thing will seriously chew through some thick brush without even thinking twice. I've accidentally cut down some small saplings around a quarter inch in diameter. The best part is that it comes with the battery, which works great with all my 20 volt MAX tools. It makes a world of difference using this battery on the half inch impact.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, more power than most people will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a beast. It has both high and low speed settings, but I have yet to use the high setting. This thing effortlessly chews through grass and weeds and even small saplings on low setting without breaking a sweat. Enough power on a single charge for me to trim the fence line, driveway, patios, walkways and landscaping on my 1.7 acre property (about 45 minutes of work, though not running the entire time obviously). I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Really nice weed eater
customer_reviews.text: Really nice weed eater. Plenty of power for whatever you need. If you are used to commercial style gas weedeaters, you will notice that the cutting swath is not as large, so you have to get closer to stuff. It is a little annoying, but I have gotten used to it. This is my only complaint. I live on 1 acre and can easily trim my whole yard and still have battery left. This machine is well balanced, is quiet and does not smell like a gas machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works well as long as line feeds correctly
customer_reviews.text: I like the trimmer and the fact that the battery pack can be used on other dewalt tools. The head and line feeder have worked very poorly for me. I have spent more time fiddling with the trim line and head than cutting weeds. I'm having a hard time finding a replacement head to try.
customer_reviews.author: Researched buy in SF Bay area

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Remember that weed trimmer you dream about everytime you mow the lawn or have to use the crappy oil/gas one you've had for a long time that causes you to go into fits of Tourettes every time you have to use it? This is that dream one you've always wanted. I know its a little on the pricey end but I promise you, this isnt a purchase you'll doubt or question afterwards. You deserve this and so does your sanity. Plus you won't have to say you're sorry anymore for blurting out four letter words within hearing of their kids. At least not due to weed whacking issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: Chop down trees (not really)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an amazing Stihl because I was tired of keeping fuel around. With the provided string, I was tearing channels in my 4x4 fence posts!! I wouldn’t use it to clear a field, but for a normal yard, this DEWALT more than does the job. I was able to use this on a 1/3 acre yard with full fence and tons of landscaping for 6 full cuttings before the battery had even discharged 50%. If you own any other DEWALT 20v tools, the battery is a bit heavy but will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: TONS OF POWER for an electric trimmer I was incredibly surprised. For the price point this is in my opinion in the upper quality and regular use category and I can faithfully say this trimmer definitely does the job, and makes fast work of tall grass and stubborn overgrowth. The trimmer does "fold" in half, however personally I would never store it in half as there is a wire inside the long shaft that I would worry of wearing out quickly or getting damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power. My only complaint is that I have other Dewalt battery products (hedge trimmer reciprocating saw and long pole loop pruner--they all seem to use a different size Dewalt battery. On the up side, they all work flawslesly and are all powerful tools, although running on a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have a shed full of batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful bugger even on low setting. It eats just about whatever you throw in front of it. A down side is that it loves to drink the juice out of those 60v batteries. The 20v one will accept the 60v but the 60v will not take the 20v just keep that in mind when purchasing. As I said excellent tool it just has a drinking problem.
customer_reviews.author: HD TOW TRUCK OPERATOR

customer_reviews.title: A Powerful, Easy-to-use, Quiet, Odorless, Easy-starting MONSTER of a String Trimmer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband just used this String Trimmer for the first time on tall, heavy grass and weeds surrounding a ditch. It is a MONSTER! He cut through that overgrown mess almost like it wasn't there. And the new type of line that DeWalt uses is so much tougher and long-lasting than the even the thickest line that we have used to this point on other trimmer brands. We are going to put our smelly, finicky gas String Trimmer up for sale tomorrow. What an improvement! Oh, and it takes an outstanding product such as this to get me to write a review; so there you go.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced and comfortable feel
customer_reviews.text: This is a very balanced string trimmer. I thought with the weight of the 60v flex battery on the back that it would be weighted more on the back, but surprisingly, it feels very comfortable and balanced. For our needs, one battery was more than enough charge to get the job done, but we have relatively small front and back yards.
customer_reviews.author: SalmonGuy

customer_reviews.title: Gas power without the gas
customer_reviews.text: Way more power than I expected from a battery powered trimmer. Always had gas ones and had a love hate relationship with them. No more mixing gas and oil. No more maintenance. No more priming. I’ve never experienced the battery dying in my use. I’d say I went 45-60 mins on high power and still had 2/3 a charge left. The bonus is the 60v works with all my 20v tools!
customer_reviews.author: P. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Poor trimmer head
customer_reviews.text: With the supplied line the line broke quickly and the head can be A ROYAL PAIN to remove. Several times it was easy, several times NOT.
customer_reviews.author: gemniii

customer_reviews.title: Cheaplt made
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 20 minutes of use. The motor seems to have either burnt out or shorted.
customer_reviews.author: Not Kidding

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but has it's issues
customer_reviews.text: I like it but I personally think this is too long. I am a tallish guy at 6 feet and I am saying that. Also, in one cutting of the grass, I had to fix the string 3 times by taking off the bump string spool. The string would stop coming out and get stuck inside.
customer_reviews.author: judgex1

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Gas-Free Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: For average usage, there's no reason to choose a gas trimmer over a battery-powered trimmer like this. It is very powerful, and handles my half acre property with 2/3 of the battery power remaining. It's strong enough on the low speed setting that I almost never use the high speed setting. The integrated hook for hanging is a nice touch. When hanging vertically it takes up very little space. It is more expensive than gas models, but remember that you never have to pay for or mess with gasoline, mixing oil, engine maintenance, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Koester

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Works eating weeds and trimming edges. Just turn it over. I've never had a bump feed before and it seems much better than having to adjust it all the time. I used the battery from my chainsaw so... bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic power with good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said: fantastic power. More than enough power and battery life for the average homeowner. I only had to switch it up to high power once so I could cut down about 70 square feet of waist high weeds. Normally I use low power and can cut normal grass around my property three times before having to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: BGF

customer_reviews.title: String problem
customer_reviews.text: I can't keep string from breaking for more than a few seconds. Anyone else have any advice
customer_reviews.author: James R Zeck

customer_reviews.title: great weedwhip
customer_reviews.text: its quiet, battery lasts a long time. bought this for a relative because they always complaining about weedwhips that are hard to start so i have to come start them, or my commercial ones are too heavy for them. well balanced with 60v 3ah battery. i enjoy using it myself. I've gotten rid of some of my commercial weed whips after getting this.
customer_reviews.author: christoph s

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCST970X1 String Trimmer
product_meta.description: Style:60V BatteryThe DEWALT 60V MAX* String Trimmer is designed to power through tough overgrowth and withstand everyday heavy-duty usage. It features a high-efficiency brushless motor that maximizes runtime and motor life, and its lightweight and ergonomic design maximizes control and minimizes stress on your arms. This kit includes a FLEXVOLT 20V/60V MAX* battery that powers 60V MAX* tools or it can be backwards compatible to work with 20V MAX* tools.
feature_bullets: Gear drive design powers through tough overgrowth
High efficiency brushless motor maximizes run time and motor life
15 in. cutting swath with 0.080 in. line (also accepts 0.095 in.)
Variable speed trigger with Hi/Lo speed control for added power or extended run time
Lightweight and ergonomic design maximizes control and minimizes stress on your arms
Designed to withstand everyday heavy duty usage
Bump feed head comes with 1 Quick Load spool of 0.08 in. dual line installed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars872 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
